data.title: UnDeR My UmBrEllA
data.meta_description: Posts about romantic princess written by Ms. Tin
data.text:
MANILA, Philippines—2bU! recently bagged an exclusive interview with two of the hottest Asian heartthrobs, Wu Chun and Calvin Chen. The two make half of the Taiwanese singing sensation Fahrenheit, which, next to F4, is the most famous male group in Taiwan and Asia.

Chun and Calvin are also the lead stars in ABS-CBN’s Romantic Princess. They arrived on June 12 (Saturday) for a three-day stay in Manila to promote the last two weeks of the series and to meet their fans.

In Fahrenheit terms (despite the rainy season in Manila), Chun and Calvin got a truly hot summer welcome from screaming fans who had waited for their arrival at the airport and faithfully watched them guest in different ABS-CBN shows on Saturday and Sunday. The fans even sang along with them—in Chinese!

Please tell us your experiences in doing “Romantic Princess.”

Chun: It made us feel very rich … rich for young kids. (laughs)

Calvin: But sometimes, money cannot buy everything.

Chun: Yeah. The storyline shows that (money) cannot buy you happiness.

(more…)

Read Full Post »

His princely looks have won him quite a following, first in the chinovela Hana Kimi The Original and now Romantic Princess, both aired on ABS-CBN. In the latter, Wu Chun plays one of the four successors to the owner-manager of a business empire whose granddaughter, played by Angela Zhang, falls head-over-heels for Wu Chun.

Beyond that, not much is known about Wu Chun.

Here’s what Conversations dug up about Wu Chun:

His real name is Goh Kiat Chun, of Chinese descent, born on Oct. 10, 1979 (a Libran), in Brunei, the youngest of three (one sister and one brother). Wu Chun comes from a wealthy family which owns Goh Hock Kee, the distributor of Mitsubishi in Brunei. He stands 5’10”, weighs 160 lbs., with type O blood and lists “actor, singer and model” as his profession.

(more…)

Read Full Post »

They are back again to warm our hearts. Both Wu Chun and Calvin Chen sang at a portion in ASAP O8. Singing the theme song from Romantic Princess. Hosted by Nicki Gil and Anne Curtis, they again confirmed that they are both single. Asked by a question if they are open on dating Filipina women, Calvin hurriedly said “Why not?”! Yes guys, you read it right! We Filipinos have a chance to be their girlfriends of both our Asian heartthrobs! Wu Chun, told everyone that they are happy for the warm welcome that they have been recieving from all of us and hopes to comeback again. In the end Wu Chun said, “I love you guys!”. And finally, both Wu Chun and Calvin Chen told everyone “Mahal ko kayo!”

As a final message, Calvin told everyone to watch Romantic Princess. Here’s what he said, “The story is not just about love, its also about friendship, family and give you the courage to pursue your dream. So remember, stay tune and keep watching Romantic Princess.

Here is a video of their performance at ASAP 08

Credits goes to:

msOwtu for the videos uploaded at youtube

Read Full Post »

Who wouldn’t fall in love with such drop-dead gorgeous guys like Asian heartthrobs Wu Chun and Calvin Chen? Almost every girl in the country wishes to end up with them while watching ABS-CBN’s phenomenal Taiwanese afternoon drama, Romantic Princess.

With the huge number of followers, it is reaping after the success of Hana Kimi, ABS-CBN invites Chun and his onscreen rival Calvin Chen to visit the country this week! This is to show how much the Kapamily network appreciates the continuous support of its viewers to all the top-rated Asianovelas it has franchised over the years.

The two Taiwanese stars share a similar background for they both entered showbiz by chance after they finished their collegiate years abroad. Chun finished Business Administration at RMIT University in Melbourne, Australia and later opened a fitness gym in Brunei, before he was asked to star in his first TV project, Tokyo Juliet, during one of his trips in Taiwan.

(more…)
